repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Strengthening Capacity for Managing
            National Parks and Biodiversity Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Strengthening Capacity for Managing
            National Parks and Biodiversity Project for Gabon had a
            moderately satisfactory outcome, with both the performances
            of the Bank and the borrower being deemed moderately
            satisfactory as well. The global environment objectives
            indicators and intermediate outcome indicators were all
            fully achieved. The project efficiency was felt to be
            satisfactory. Significant lessons learned during the
            implementation of the project include: 1) the comparative
            features of core technical capacity and project management
            capacity; 2) effective capacity strengthening being a
            long-term endeavor; and 3) effective inter-agency
            collaboration being crucial for success.

14522547.trustfund:
TF056592-GEF FSP-GABONESE REPUBLIC:
            STRENGTHENING CAPACITY FOR MANAGING NATIONAL

repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Strengthening Capacity for Managing
            National Parks and Biodiversity Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The revised development objective of the
            Strengthening Capacity for Managing National Parks and
            Biodiversity Project is to enhance the conservation of
            biodiversity in selected National Parks and buffer zones,
            and strengthen the management capacity of selected
            conservation-related entities in Gabon. The restructuring is
            to better align the project activities to: 1) the priorities
            in the conservation area in Gabon, including some emerging
            needs that had not been identified during the preparation of
            the project as well as; 2) the existing institutional
            capacities. These adjustments will also imply some resource
            reallocations amongst the different categories of
            expenditures as well as a 12-month extension of the closing
            date. Additionally, it is to align the formulation of the
            Project Development Objectives (PDO) as described in the
            Project Appraisal Document (PAD) with those negotiated and
            agreed upon by the bank and the recipient in the grant
            agreement. The change reflects the changes in the national
            priorities in terms of conservation in Gabon.
